meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Dee Daigle Emily Poole Markus Kolic Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #7200.

div.div: Alex uses a cane during the closing credits chat.

td.p: Dee Daigle, a substitute teacher from Hebron, Connecticut
Emily Poole, a musician from Hendersonville, North Carolina
Markus Kolic, a data base devloper and stay-at-home dad from Dighton, Massachusetts (whose 1-day cash winnings total $15,300)

tr.td: (Alex: We'll give you the model, you give us the make.)
(Sarah: From the Malting & Brewing Science Program at UC Davis, the craft and science that go into a cold one.)

(Alex: Ooh, hurry.)
(Markus: ...porters?)
(Alex: Oh, no. What are [*] and [**]?)
(Markus: Ah!)
(Alex: [**]. All right, no big loss.)

lagers & ales

Markus
')

The two basic types of brewing yeast are top-fermenting & bottom-fermenting, corresponding to these two basic kinds of beer, one including stouts & one including pilsners')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: (Sarah of the Clue Crew delivers the clue from the UC Davis Malting & Brewing Science program.) The two basic types of brewing yeast are top-fermenting & bottom-fermenting, corresponding to these two basic kinds of beer, one including stouts & one including pilsners
